item.description: The president borrows a Biden tactic, deflecting public concerns about prices by blaming food producers.

item.title: A simple way to end the shutdown
item.description: Rename Obamacare — or suspend taxes.

item.title: Why I choose to root for U.S. dominance
item.description: In a dangerous world, America needs its political, economic and cultural edge.

item.title: America’s land crisis is roaring back into politics
item.description: Henry George shows why rent control and taxes won’t solve nation’s land crisis.

item.title: Biden and Trump, in their own ways, poisoned the immigration debate
item.description: Even now, when the need is urgent, neither political party will seize the moment for immigration reform.

item.title: Wes Moore embarrasses Maryland with his gerrymandering ploy
item.description: The Democratic leader of the state Senate deserves praise for resisting pressure from the governor.

item.title: Put the Mona Lisa in its own building — for its sake and the visitors’
item.description: What might be the world’s most famous painting needs to be easy to see and hard to steal.

item.title: Nigeria’s crisis runs deeper than just a war on Christians
item.description: The Trump administration is dangerously misreading the conflict and its causes.

item.title: Yes, colleges face a crisis. It’s also an opportunity.
item.description: Over two centuries, American higher education has periodically remade itself. Time to do it again.

item.description: A big win for property rights on a small island, and a liberal enclave rejects tax hikes.

item.title: The science that extended Dick Cheney’s life was a choice
item.description: The biomedical research engine will create more breakthroughs — if we keep it up and running.
